text: Some time later Absalom managed to acquire a chariot and horses, as well as 50 men to serve as his royal guard.

Now <st data-num="053" class="">Absalom</st> used to <st data-num="07925" class="">get up early</st> and <st data-num="05975" class="">stand</st> <st data-num="05921 03027">beside</st> the <st data-num="01870" class="">road</st> that led to the city <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st>. Whenever <st data-num="03605 0376">anyone</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">came by</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">had</st> a <st data-num="07379" class="">complaint</st> to <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> for <st data-num="04941" class="">arbitration</st>, <st data-num="053" class="">Absalom</st> would <st data-num="07121 0559">call out</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, “<st data-num="0335" class="">What</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> are <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">from</st>?” The person would <st data-num="0559" class="">answer</st>, “I, your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st>,<n id="1" /> am from <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="07626" class="">tribes</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.”

<st data-num="053" class="">Absalom</st> would then <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, “<st data-num="07200" class="">Look</st>, your <st data-num="01697" class="">claims</st> are <st data-num="02896" class="">legitimate</st> and <st data-num="05228" class="">appropriate</st>.<n id="1" /> But <st data-num="0369">there is no</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">representative</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> who will <st data-num="08085" class="">listen</st> to you.”
Absalom would then say, “If only they would make me a judge in the land! Then everyone who had a judicial complaint could come to me and I would make sure he receives a just settlement.”
When someone approached to bow before him, Absalom would extend his hand and embrace him and kiss him.
Absalom acted this way toward everyone in Israel who came to the king for justice. In this way Absalom won the loyalty of the citizens of Israel.
After four years Absalom said to the king, “Let me go and repay my vow that I made to the Lord while I was in Hebron.
For I made this vow when I was living in Geshur in Aram: ‘If the Lord really does allow me to return to Jerusalem, I will serve the Lord.’”
The king replied to him, “Go in peace.” So Absalom got up and went to Hebron.
Then Absalom sent spies through all the tribes of Israel who said, “When you hear the sound of the horn, you may assume that Absalom rules in Hebron.”

Now <st data-num="03967" class="">200</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> had <st data-num="01980" class="">gone</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> <st data-num="053" class="">Absalom</st> from <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>. Since they were <st data-num="07121" class="">invited</st>, they <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> <st data-num="08537" class="">naively</st> and were <st data-num="03808 03045">unaware</st> of <st data-num="03605">what</st> Absalom was <st data-num="01697" class="">planning</st>.<n id="1" />

While he was offering sacrifices, Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, David’s adviser, to come from his city, Giloh. The conspiracy was gaining momentum, and the people were starting to side with Absalom.
Then a messenger came to David and reported, “The men of Israel are loyal to Absalom!”

So <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="06965" class="">Come on</st>!<n id="2" /> Let’s <st data-num="01272" class="">escape</st>!<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">Otherwise</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> one will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="06413" class="">delivered</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">from</st> <st data-num="053" class="">Absalom</st>! <st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st> <st data-num="04116" class="">immediately</st>, <st data-num="06435" class="">or else</st> he will <st data-num="04116" class="">quickly</st> <st data-num="05381" class="">overtake</st> us and <st data-num="05080" class="">bring</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="07451" class="">disaster</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> us and <st data-num="05221" class="">kill</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city’s residents</st> <st data-num="06310" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st>.”<n id="5" />
The king’s servants replied to the king, “We will do whatever our lord the king decides.”
So the king and all the members of his royal court set out on foot, though the king left behind 10 concubines to attend to the palace.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">set out</st> on <st data-num="07272" class="">foot</st>, <st data-num="05975" class="">pausing</st><n id="1" /> at <st data-num="01004" class="">a spot</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="04801" class="">some distance away</st>.
All his servants were leaving with him, along with all the Kerethites, all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites—some 600 men who had come on foot from Gath. They were leaving with the king.
Then the king said to Ittai the Gittite, “Why should you come with us? Go back and stay with the new king, for you are a foreigner and an exile from your own country.

It seems as if you arrived just yesterday. Today should I make you wander around by going with us? I go where I must go. But as for you, go back and take your men with you. May genuine loyal love protect you!”
But Ittai replied to the king, “As surely as the Lord lives and as my lord the king lives, wherever my lord the king is, whether it means death or life, there I will be as well!”
So David said to Ittai, “Come along then.” So Ittai the Gittite went along, accompanied by all his men and all the dependents who were with him.
All the land was weeping loudly as all these people were leaving. As the king was crossing over the Kidron Valley, all the people were leaving on the road that leads to the desert.

Zadok and all the Levites who were with him were carrying the ark of the covenant of God. When they positioned the ark of God, Abiathar offered sacrifices until all the people had finished leaving the city.
Then the king said to Zadok, “Take the ark of God back to the city. If I find favor in the Lord’s sight he will bring me back and enable me to see both it and his dwelling place again.
However, if he should say, ‘I do not take pleasure in you,’ then he will deal with me in a way that he considers appropriate.”
The king said to Zadok the priest, “Are you a seer? Go back to the city in peace! Your son Ahimaaz and Abiathar’s son Jonathan may go with you and Abiathar.

<st data-num="07200" class="">Look</st>, <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> will be <st data-num="04102" class="">waiting</st> at the <st data-num="05679" class="">fords</st> of the <st data-num="04057" class="">desert</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">word</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">from</st> you<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0935 05046">reaches</st> me.”
So Zadok and Abiathar took the ark of God back to Jerusalem and remained there.

As David was going up the Mount of Olives, he was weeping as he went; his head was covered and his feet were bare. All the people who were with him also had their heads covered and were weeping as they went up.
Now David had been told, “Ahithophel has sided with the conspirators who are with Absalom.” So David prayed, “Make the advice of Ahithophel foolish, O Lord.”
When David reached the summit, where he used to worship God, Hushai the Arkite met him with his clothes torn and dirt on his head.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> you <st data-num="05674" class="">leave</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> me you will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> a <st data-num="04853" class="">burden</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> me.

But you will be able to <st data-num="06565" class="">counter</st> the <st data-num="06098" class="">advice</st> of <st data-num="0302" class="">Ahithophel</st> <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> you <st data-num="07725" class="">go back</st> to the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st> to <st data-num="053" class="">Absalom</st>, ‘<st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> will be your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st>, O <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>! <st data-num="0227" class="">Previously</st> <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> your <st data-num="01" class="">father’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st>, and <st data-num="06258" class="">now</st> <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> will be your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st>.’

<st data-num="06659" class="">Zadok</st> and <st data-num="054" class="">Abiathar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> will be <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> <st data-num="03808 05973">with</st> you.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01961 03605 01697 0834">Everything</st> you <st data-num="08085" class="">hear</st> in the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st><n id="2" /> you must <st data-num="05046" class="">tell</st> <st data-num="06659" class="">Zadok</st> and <st data-num="054" class="">Abiathar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>.
Furthermore, their two sons are there with them, Zadok’s son Ahimaaz and Abiathar’s son Jonathan. You must send them to me with any information you hear.”
So David’s friend Hushai arrived in the city, just as Absalom was entering Jerusalem.
